javadoc:
Class that is a JButton that has an empty border and adds a mouse listener
 so that the button looks raised when the mouse pointer enters the button,
 and looks lowered when the mouse pointer exits the button.

methods.javadoc:
Construct a new EmptyBorderButton that has the given button text.
@param text text of the button
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Construct a new EmptyBorderButton that has the given button text.

methods.javadoc:
Construct a new EmptyBorderButton that has an associated action.
@param a action for the button
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Construct a new EmptyBorderButton that has an associated action.

methods.javadoc:
Construct a new EmptyBorderButton that has an icon.
@param icon icon for the button
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Construct a new EmptyBorderButton that has an icon.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Construct a new EmptyBorderButton that has text and an icon.

methods.javadoc: Clear the border on this button and set it to NO_BORDER.
methods.name: clearBorder
methods.comment: Clear the border on this button and set it to NO_BORDER.

methods.javadoc:
Override the default border created by this button.
@param overrideBorder new border to use
methods.name: setOverrideBorder
methods.comment: Override the default border created by this button.

name: SmallBorderButton
comment:
Class that is a JButton that has an empty border and adds a mouse listener
 so that the button looks raised when the mouse pointer enters the button,
 and looks lowered when the mouse pointer exits the button.
